channel.title: Homes on Shirui Pan
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Shirui Pan

item.description: About Shirui Shirui Pan is a Lecturer with the Machine Learning Group, Faculty of Information Technology, Monash University. Prior to this, he was a Lecturer with the Centre for Artificial Intelligence (CAI), School of Software, Faculty of Engineering and Information Technology, University of Technology Sydney(UTS). Shirui received his Ph.D degree in computer science from UTS, Australia, under the supervision of Professor Chengqi Zhang and Xingquan Zhu. His research interests include data mining and machine learning, specialized in graph mining and network analysis.

item.title: What's New
item.description: Two papers are accepted by IEEE ICDM-2019 (09/08/2019). Domain-Adversarial Graph Neural Networks for Text Classification. Relation Structure-Aware Heterogeneous Graph Neural Network. Two papers are accepted by ACM CIKM-2019 (09/08/2019). Long-short Distance Aggregation Networks for Positive Unlabeled Graph Learning. An Accurate and Explainable Deep Learning Algorithm for Affect Recognition. One Paper on Graph Embedding is Accepted by IEEE Transactions on Cybernetics (IF: 10.387) (23/07/2019). One Paper on Knowledge Graph Embedding is Accepted by WWWJ (22/07/2019).

item.title: Grants

item.title: Students
item.description: I am co-supervising or working closely with the following Higher Degree Research (HDR) students: Ruiqi Hu (UTS, Completed) Chun Wang (UTS) Zonghan Wu (UTS) Shaoxiong Ji (UQ) Hong Yang (UTS) Fengwen Chen (UTS) Zhineng Fu (UTS, SCUT) Ximeng Wang (UTS, BJU) Guojia Wan (WHU)
